topics.body:
More than likely going to cause a severe argument but I read something very interesting about the state of usa society:
[spoiler]
A article I was reading was talking about femininity vs masculinity and why traps and such are becoming more and more popular; the theory was that looking at the past 200 years culturally in the usa on the topic of femininity vs masculinity there is still masculinity and femininity today in distinct lines, but over the past 200 years femininity has been getting progressively pushed more and more towards each other.  What I mean by this is that if a woman shows up to a lot of work places in a sunflower dress with a parasol with a hello kitty purse that's not the norm (I don't mean normal rather it's not the defacto state).

While it is good that women don't have dress in sunday dresses all the time there is a unforseen side effect; gender norms are incapable of occupying the same space cause if they occupy the same norm then there's no more gender norms and while a lot of groups aim for the removal of gender norms in a macro scale it's just not a feasible endeavour because while gender norms are weakening there will always be in some form gender norms and by forcibly pushing it in the opposite direction only pushes the gender norms apart.

Basically what the theory was that in say fifty years it will be okay for men to be either masculine or feminine, but it won't be "okay" for women to be feminine and that the more you try to fit against gender norms the more and more you will alienate women who do like to be feminine and make them feel like "freaks" for being feminine and as a result the theory postulates that over time more and more men will fill that femininity gap.

Tl:dr; the theory states that there's more and more mtf traps because more and more women are starting to feel ashamed for acting feminine and as a result if it's considered socially okay for men to be either feminine or masculine that men will fill that gap.

Tl:dr of tl:dr;
Femininity ---------------------------- Masculinity
Gender norms by decade:
1950:
women --------------------------------- men
1990:
------------ women ------------- men -------
Today:
------------------women -- men ------------
2050:
------men ---------------------- women-----
[/spoiler]

topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5521bdcc63687244186f0f00#post_5521bdcc63687244186f0f00
So anyway; honest opinion in a un-angry manner what do you think about that theory I presented?

It's just a theory, but the reason why I think it might actually be true is that on sex sites and such larger and larger groups of men think women are becoming too masculine for their tastes.  Going on foreign sites the immediate reaction by men in other countries is "american women are just men with boobs".

While I completely think that's uncalled for, and before you accuse me having the same belief no I don't, I was just talking about it cause it shows that the usa is developing a huge problem socially; essentially if in say 20 years it's no longer socially acceptable for women to be feminine wouldn't that pose a problem considering how many men like feminine women?

Tl:dr; what's going to happen to the usa if the majority of men are no longer sexually interest in women anymore?
